article.title: GT version MDS4 Information Providers
article.para: This section describes information providers (TODO: glossary) used to gather information either via execution aggregator sources (in the Aggregator Framework) or via UsefulRP.
If you have an information provider you would like to submit to the Globus Toolkit, download a folder with README instructions and template files here (currently available as a zip file).

row.entry: The following information providers are available for MDS4:
This provider gathers Hawkeye data about Condor pool resources using the XML mapping of the GLUE schema and reports it to a GRAM4 service, which publishes it as resource properties.

This provider collects information from two sources: the scheduler and the cluster information system (for example Ganglia or Hawkeye) using the XML mapping of the GLUE schema and reports it to a GRAM4 service, which publishes it as resource properties.
This provider gathers data from a Nagios system and publishes it into the Index Service in the standard GLUE schema.

This provider monitors systems for statistics like memory usage, CPU load, network load and disk load, collects the data from all specified gkrellmd servers, exposes the collected data as a WSRF resource, and publishes the resource to the Index Service.
This provider allows a set of performance benchmarks to be run and aggregates the results of the test back into the Index Service.

This provider connects to a GridFTP server, reads its banner, and puts the banner in the Index Service. If the connection cannot be made in 30 seconds or some other error occurs, the server is marked as down.
This provider connects to a web server. If the connection can successful be made the server is registered as alive, otherwise it is down.

This provider will monitor the life of a remote certificate. It connects to an SSL TCP listener and obtains the certificate from it. It then checks the certificate for subject, start date, end data, and email address. All of this information is put in the Index Service if it is successfully obtained.
